body_html:
@on-the-run @bobzhuyb, the assumption doesn't make sense to me.
The memory is being pinned in https://github.com/torvalds/linux/blob/master/drivers/infiniband/core/umem.c#L83 , which is executed in the ibv_reg_mr flow, so mlcok shouldn't have any effect.
Also as @byronyi (this is what I know as well) said, TF doesn't support UVM.
Are u sure this is the only thing u changed that fixed the bug ?

I'm having a similar issue with 8 P100 per node (4 nodes), happens with only certain conditions (tf_cnn_script benchmark with "real" data) and the pinning issue is not the case.
I think maybe found the issue (checking now and will report soon).

body:
@on-the-run @bobzhuyb, the assumption doesn't make sense to me.
The memory is being pinned in https://github.com/torvalds/linux/blob/master/drivers/infiniband/core/umem.c#L83 , which is executed in the ibv_reg_mr flow, so mlcok shouldn't have any effect.
Also as @byronyi (this is what I know as well) said, TF doesn't support UVM.
Are u sure this is the only thing u changed that fixed the bug ? 

I'm having a similar issue with 8 P100 per node (4 nodes), happens with only certain conditions (tf_cnn_script benchmark with "real" data) and the pinning issue is not the case.
I think maybe found the issue (checking now and will report soon).
